title: How to Start Calisthenics at Home For Beginners (No Equipment)
description:
Join S-Class (my private coaching community around calisthenics/fitness and mindset): https://www.skool.com/s-class/about

Join the S-Tier (our free self-improvement community): https://www.skool.com/s-tier-4721/about

Train with me on my app and get all my calishenics programs: www.dalatifit.com

Click here to subscribe -  @dalati 

Email for Business inquiries: contact.dalati@gmail.com

Check Out My Other Socials!
Instagram ► ​https://www.instagram.com/pierredalati?igsh=MWQweTl4anYwN29odg%3D%3D&utm_source=qr
TikTok ► ​https://www.tiktok.com/@pierredalati?_t=8jRQ70r9gu5&_r=1

Calisthenics uses your body weight as resistance, making it a convenient and effective workout that can be done at home. To start, create a simple routine consisting of basic movements such as push-ups, squats, and sit-ups. Make sure to warm up properly with light cardio and stretching to prevent injury. Start with low reps and gradually increase as you get stronger. Incorporate rest days into your routine to allow your muscles time to recover. Remember to focus on form over speed and use modifications if needed. With consistency and dedication, you'll see improvement in your strength and mobility.

10/7/23 - Started doing these exercises in September, commenting now because I was able to stay consistent. First month I already see muscle growth, it’s actually crazy. Gonna comment again by the end of the year
EDIT- For my workout routine I like to do chest, arms, and shoulders in one day and abs, back, and legs the next day and just alternate for 5 days a week. I recommend searching up a diet plan as well to get improved results. Also minor note I have been biking for a year so my legs are in decent shape but it was not working out every part of the legs. This is also what got me into calisthenics because only my legs had muscles definition and the rest of my body was all flab.
12/31/23 - I stayed consistent and I’ve noticed major growth in my arms, upper chest and traps. Minor but still noticeable growth in forearms, lower chest and shoulders. Endurance and amount of reps has improved as well. Many of the harder exercises I couldn’t do, I can do now. Gonna keep on grinding and update my progress in March.
3/2/24 - I’m so excited to give you all my calisthenics update! Forearms are looking more defined and bigger. Shoulders have steady progress. My chest fat has slowly been burning away and is being replaced with muscle!! I never thought i would be able to get rid of this! I’ve gotten a few compliments of my arms and it just gives me motivation to keep going. I can do a pistol squat and an L sit!! I tried doing pistol squats around November and I could not do them at all, I tried again last month and I was surprised I was able to go all the way down and back up!! The same thing with L sit, I can only hold it for 5 seconds but it’s so much better from when I first started. I wasn’t able to lift my feet up at all and I thought it was because my legs were too long. Still working on my handstand too, I was able to hold multiple attempts for 3 seconds but my biggest struggle is balance and I get scared. I’m gonna update again in the summer! Wish everyone the strength to keep going through their workouts! It’s worth it!!
6/25/24 - Ngl I haven’t consistently been doing my workouts recently bc I got a girlfriend and we’ve been hanging out everyday so I’ve been lacking. Today I’m going back to consistently doing my workouts again. My first day back felt exactly how I felt when I first began my journey. I got pretty sore for 4 days so I couldn’t really do my workouts. My second day back today and I’m feeling better and I’m trying to push myself even more bc I don’t want to break my streak again. I’ll update again in August
8/24/24 - I’m almost hitting the 1 year mark!! Not much of my workout routine has changed but I did add an explosive push-up variation to my incline. I tried getting some running and swimming in as well. I have been wanting to go to the gym to grow a bit more. I don’t want to overdo going to the gym because I still want to be flexible. I tried going 1-2 times a week. I’m getting an insane amount of compliments on my forearms compared to last year. Arm veins have also been popping out so that’s a plus for anyone who has been going for those. After tons of practice, I’ve been able to do a handstand!! Still working on my balance and being to hold it till failure. I’m really glad I started these workouts. Every time someone asks me if I go to the gym, I tell them I just do calisthenics at home and they get so surprised. I started my logs as an inspiration for others because I know if I saw a comment like this I would totally be inspired. Especially if they’re still updating to this day!!
10/16/24 - Still doing my workouts to this day. What a journey this has been! Over a year now! I’m a totally different person than I was when I first started. All exercises have been the same and my diet has stayed the same. I do a little bit of gym to increase muscle size but also not over doing it.
1/3/25 Sorry for the late update, I was busy during December but that didn’t stop me from trying to get whatever workout I can. I’m not going to lie you guys, I didn’t put in as much work as I wanted to this time around but I’m still satisfied with what I was able to put in. It’s honestly gotten to the point where I have the physique I’ve wanted. It’s just so satisfying to see everyday because I know the amount of effort I put in to achieving it. I’m so glad I started. I’m so glad I was able to stay consistent. I’m proud of myself. It’s a new year and that only means more motivation. I’m gonna keep my workouts consistent. Nothing from my workout has changed significantly. The only thing is my diet. I’ve been eating chicken and rice religiously. I’ve been trying to gain weight so that helps with bulking. I can’t wait till I start cutting. I’ll update again after a while. Thank you so much for the motivation in the comments. I wish you all the best!
